page.title: 02COCKEN TUNNEL/THE SLAG BANK
page.content:
{ Cocken Tunnel}passes under the Slag Bank which extends for over 1km along the shore of the channel between Ormsgill and Walney Island. It is on the{old footpath}used by the{monks of {Furness Abbey}when they wanted to cross by boat to their lands on Walney Island.
{ The Slag Bank}was made from the waste from the iron ore that was used in the {Steelworks.}The works{closed down}two years ago, but{iron}is the reason why {Barrow started to grow 150 years ago. Railway lines from Barrow were sent all over the world.
{ The land is slowly being reclaimed, because the slag is being taken away to fill building land and help make foundations for new roads, so the tunnel may disappear one day.
